title: High Forest Rents Contribution
description: In 2021, forest rents accounted for 18.40% of Solomon Islands' GDP, highlighting the significant role of forestry in the country's economy.

title: Low Primary School Intake Rate
description: In 2018, the net intake rate for grade 1 was notably low at 9.23% for the official school-age population, indicating challenges in primary education access.

title: Minimal Private Health Expenditure
description: In 2022, domestic private health expenditure per capita was only $3.65, reflecting limited private investment in health services.

title: High Female Employment Rate
description: In 2024, the employment to population ratio for females aged 15 and above was 81.18%, showcasing strong female workforce participation.

title: Significant Family Worker Contribution
description: In 2023, contributing family workers made up 49.26% of total employment, indicating a reliance on family-based labor.

title: High Tariff Rates on Primary Products
description: In 2022, the tariff rate for primary products was 48.84%, one of the highest globally, affecting trade dynamics.

title: Dominance of Agricultural Exports
description: In 2018, agricultural raw materials constituted 73.29% of merchandise exports, underscoring the sector's export significance.

title: Low International Tourism Expenditure
description: In 2020, international tourism expenditures for passenger transport items were notably low, at just under $10,000, indicating limited tourism activity.
